result.execSummary:
The defendant Laron A Batey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
May transfer probation to Dane County.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff's Dept. Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions, sign releases.
ATTEND the Victim Impact Panel meeting (may attend in Dane County) or serve penalty of 30 days Huber, consecutive for non-attendance.
Comply with any Mental Health/Psychological evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate by agent.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended. Case 15TR140 was dismissed and read in. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions, commencing forthwith. May transfer authority to Dane County. Sentence credit of 4 days were granted.

records.addlTxt: letter from Journey Mental Health and medication sheet filed by Attorney Masnica
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Laron A Batey in court with Attorney Nicole M Masnica.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #3.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count     #3.  Counts #1 & 2 are dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Masnica makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #3:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  18 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  18 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS      **transfer allowed to Dane County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed/sign releases.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
*Mental Heath / Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate per agent.
*Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license
*Attend a Victim Impact Panel (in Dane County allowed)  -  Defendant to serve 30 days huber, consecutive, as penalty for failure to attend Victim Impact Panel.  

*D/L REVOCATION: 30 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 24 months.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00  (to be paid to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department and to be paid as a condition of probation);

FINE:  $1,582.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid as a condition of probation - CASH BAIL POSTED TO BE RETURNED TO POSTER);

CONDITION TIME:  210 Days (4 days credit) - Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith. Transfer allowed to Dane County. 

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-11-2016 11:00 am
